div.h3: BETA Club members place at State and advance to Nationals. Paige Sheridan 5th in Mathematics. Emma Worsham, Paige Sheridan, Marianna Hoover & Madison Hughston, 5th in Robotics.
West Bank & Trust Company Debit Cards

p.span: After careful consideration, Fairview administration has devised a plan for the end of the year. We know many of you have questions about graduation and summer school, and unfortunately we cannot answer those at this time. But be assured we are working on options and will notify you as soon as possible. Any awards that were to be given at the end of the year will be mailed to students with the exception of 8

grade. Eighth grade awards’ distribution will depend on the decision about graduation. AR trophies will be given out at the beginning of the 2020-2021 school year. Fourth quarter grades will be figured using 3

quarter grades with an additional 100 points averaged in. If your child is in a lower grade where letter grades and percentages are not used, teachers will use professional judgement to complete grade cards. Grade cards will also be mailed.
We will continue to distribute meals weekly as long as we are able to do so. This will be each
from 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. New work packets will also be available this Saturday, April 18

during the food pickup. These will be the last work packets and will contain work through the end of the year. Counselors will be including a scheduling questionnaire to help schedule upper grade students’ elective classes. Please look for these in all 5
grade work packets. Fill these out as soon as possible and return to school in the provided postage paid envelope.

Plans have been made for parents/students to pick up personal belongings and return school property including library books, textbooks, uniforms, instruments, classroom books, and any other items borrowed from the school. Teachers will be here in the drive through with your child’s personal belongings ready for pickup on the following days:
If you cannot pick up on your scheduled day, please contact your child’s teacher to make arrangements. If belongings are not picked up by May 13
, items will not be available to pick up until school starts back.
Thank you for your support during this time!

div.p: After careful consideration, Fairview administration has devised a plan for the end of the year. We know many of you have questions about graduation and summer school, and unfortunately we cannot answer those at this time. But be assured we are working on options and will notify you as soon as possible. Any awards that were to be given at the end of the year will be mailed to students with the exception of 8th grade. Eighth grade awards’ distribution will depend on the decision about graduation. AR trophies will be given out at the beginning of the 2020-2021 school year. Fourth quarter grades will be figured using 3rd quarter grades with an additional 100 points averaged in. If your child is in a lower grade where letter grades and percentages are not used, teachers will use professional judgement to complete grade cards. Grade cards will also be mailed.

We will continue to distribute meals weekly as long as we are able to do so. This will be each Saturday from 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. New work packets will also be available this Saturday, April 18th during the food pickup. These will be the last work packets and will contain work through the end of the year. Counselors will be including a scheduling questionnaire to help schedule upper grade students’ elective classes. Please look for these in all 5th, 6th, and 7th grade work packets. Fill these out as soon as possible and return to school in the provided postage paid envelope.

Plans have been made for parents/students to pick up personal belongings and return school property including library books, textbooks, uniforms, instruments, classroom books, and any other items borrowed from the school. Teachers will be here in the drive through with your child’s personal belongings ready for pickup on the following days:
Saturday, May 9th – Preschool, kindergarten, 1st, 2nd, and 3rd grades

If you cannot pick up on your scheduled day, please contact your child’s teacher to make arrangements. If belongings are not picked up by May 13th, items will not be available to pick up until school starts back.
Thank you for your support during this time!
